* A tiny ladybug crawled along the length of her arm, its bright red and 
black shell shining in the sun as it continued to walk.
But soon the feeling of the small insects� tiny feet against her arm woke 
Iron Raptor, opening one of her eyes very slowly to see the little bug stop 
and look back at her. But she failed to notice that what it was walking on 
was the bare blue skin of her own arm. All she saw was the little red bug.

< A ladybug > was her thoughts, seeing how cute it was, her mouth turning in 
the corners to for a smile. But even though she could see the small bug, she 
wasn�t completely awake yet, and also failed to see a whisp of short white 
hair flow across the bridge of her nose, a piece, which made up her bangs.
Iron Raptor just continued to watch the little insect with her crystal blue 
eyes, not moving a muscle. But then, as she watched the ladybug, she 
remembered just what had happened, opening both of her eyes as she went 
through the events in her mind.

Both her beast modes had merged and began the conflict, leaving her stuck in 
a black nightmarish mode which had been neither but both.
Then her thoughts skipped to the merge, and remembered closing her eyes�but 
not opening them again until now.
What had happened during the time that she had been out?
Just as sudden as mer mind asked the question a flood of images and events 
flushed into her mind, making her sit up in a jerk and press her fingers to 
her temple while supporting herself with her other arm. Her white hair 
moving in a flurry before settling around her shoulders once again, covering 
her back, chest and thighs.
Iron Raptor closed her eyes as she tried to focus on the images.

There were millions of sparks, all around and everywhere. But Beyond the 
sparks�beyond them was just darkness.
But then, then there was a voice, gentle one that seemed almost to sound 
powerful at the same time. Though, while also sounding as if it was most 
knowledge able but also wanted to know more. Yet, still as if speaking from 
a higher plain. It spoke.

� Welcome, Prowl.�

Prowl? It was then that she could hear his voice, asking question after 
question until finally it all stopped and focused upon one feeling, one, 
which made Iron Raptors spark sink along with the feeling.
Also hearing the words.

Prowl: � And Iron Raptor?�

She hears Prowl ask, feeling almost as if her spark sank as his did.

Voice: � She didn�t end up here, � they ( both her along with Prowl) heard 
the voice reply, � But she died in your arms, Prowl.� It finished.
But only one whole word in that sentence lingered in her mind, � died�? So, 
she had died? Or could it just be some sort of dream she couldn�t remember 
having? No, this was all too real to be that.
Then what?
But then it all went on; Prowls sadness, then both him and the Matrix? Was 
that it?
Yes.
Then, both him and it, no�that, continued to talk back and forth until some 
sort of deal was arranged, one made so that she could live.
But then, just after that, the image of the blue sky came into her mind, 
after being thrown into a body again. Prowls body.
Were these�Prowls memories?
Other images flashed in her mind, ones of Prowls old friends and family, of 
when he had served under Striker. But then it all went black and there was 
nothing, but then a feeling, one she knew well.
Love.
Though, this feeling of love was accompanied by others as well; wonder, 
admiration.
And then an image of�herself?
She could see herself, sitting, eyes closed. But it didn�t look like herself 
at all, not like she remembered.
What she was seeing reminded her of the forms of human women she had seen in 
history files before�only this one was larger, and she had long white hair 
and blue skin, the same color as her own. But this woman wasn�t wearing any 
cloths, though all of the privet areas were hidden by the white hair, which 
fell from her head.
She was pressing her fingers to her head, and just as Iron Raptor opened her 
eyes, so did the woman in her mind. But then something occurred to her, was 
this herself that she was looking at? And if so, then whose eyes was she 
looking through at the moment?
The image of the woman disappeared as Iron Raptor brought her mind back into 
focus, lowering her fingers from her temple and then looking at them in 
wonder. However, then she noticed white hair falling over her shoulder, 
making it so that she couldn�t see the source of this love that she was 
feeling.
Iron Raptor then brushed the hair aside, looking up and then finding herself 
gazing towards a�fuzor? No, in her spark and mind she knew who it was.
He just looked so�so�different.
Iron Raptor turned her crystal blue eyes towards the mans optics, her voice 
soft and smooth.*

� Prowl?�
